aors.util.economics
Class ContinuousQuantity

java.lang.Object
  aors.util.economics.Quantity
      aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantity

public class ContinuousQuantity
extends Quantity

The datatype class ContinuousQuantity allows to define continuous quantites (such as 2.3 liters of water, 2 kJ of energy or 7.5 hours of labor) by creating a suitable continuous quantity type (such as Water, Energy or Labor) as an instance of the datatype class ContinuousQuantityType and then creating an instance of ContinuousQuantity while setting its type property to that type. Author: Gerd Wagner (3-Sept-2010) ISSUES - should this class implement Cloneable?

deposit

public void deposit(double amount)
Add an amount of this type of continuous quantity. A RuntimeException will be thrown if amount is negative.

Specified by:
deposit in class Quantity

withdraw

public double withdraw(double amount)
Remove an amount of this type of continuous quantity. If quantity is smaller than amount, quantity is set to 0. Returns the amount successfully withdrawn. A RuntimeException will be thrown if amount is negative.

Specified by:
withdraw in class Quantity
